titleStmt.title: Thomas W. Shackelford et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4124

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Gen Bramlette Govenor of Kentucky the Undersigned petitioners Would Respectfully Represent. that at the Term of MLean Circuit Court. Judgement. Was Renderd against J W. Taylor. On a forfited Recognizance as a Witness in a Cause he Was attached in and that R. A. Hunt. Replied the same for J W. Taylor that Said Taylor has since gone South and has no property Out of Which the Debt. Can be made and your petitions Would & Respectfully ask that the fine be Remitted as to R. A. Hunt as it Will be a great Hardship for him to pay the same and We think in Justice the same should be Remitted

Names
Thoas M Shackilford Sheriff McLean
M. J. Keplinger
A. Dyer
G. G. Jones
Levi Howard
W T Owen
Louis L Moore clk
John W Moore Dept clk
A F. Watkins
James Landram
Benj. H. Franklin
A. T. Coffman
Isaac Calhoon
James M. Cosly
D. Little presiding Judge for Sd County
Names
D C Turner
Wm H. Williams P.M.
E H Mosely Jailor M.C
William Humfrey
J M Shutt
H.D. Bunett

McLean Ct Ct
vs
R. A. Hunt
Forfeiture
ansd 19th Sept/63

Pet for remission of forfeiture. vs R A Hunt
Refused Sept 19th 1863
